topics.body:
I'm gonna be honest here.

Every time I go on an airplane, I imagine the worst case scenarios that could happen (airplane blowing up, thunderstorms, volcanic ash, etc) and even though I have went on an airplane countless of times, these scenarios I keep imagining frighten me more than hell.

How do I stop doing this stuff?!

(Also, I recently imagined that when I go to college, the plane will blow up)

topics.body:
"@Twisty":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/549be60c63687218839c0700#post_549be60c63687218839c0700
[bq="Twisty"]"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/549be5456368725423760d00#post_549be5456368725423760d00

yes.

actually i just started making acounts and noticed how fucking expensive games are for us

seriously, the minimum wage per day for us is equal to a 5 dollar game.

imagine buying a 60 dollar one jesus christ.

pirating is far safer for me.[/bq]
Normally I go "yarr harr fidely dee", but I have to point something out; video games are getting progressively cheaper and cheaper when you take into inflation.  *Most* of the video game industry gets it that people want cheaper games.
There's multiple problems though; well for one some AAA companies think that people want more expensive games which is why you see shit like Destiny where dlc is was already planned from day one and they expect you to pay $60 on top of that $60 for the game believing that people want games that cost $120.
The secondary problem is that people are afraid to go freemium cause they see the crap capcom and company pull and the backlash and think that people fundamentally hate freemium games even if it's like TF2's system or LoL's system and are afraid that any game that is free2play will have backlash.
The third problem is that a lot of companies push that $60 mark super super super hard even if the game doesn't warrant it and if the game doesn't need to be $60 AAA companies push the idea of "then you make it cost $60".

I totally agree that there is a cost problem, but don't blame valve; blame companies like crapcom, EA or such ramming their cock down people's throats.
